title: "you smell good" loopy script on Hallmark e-card
content:
Hello, could you please help me with this script _(that's from a Hallmark ecard)_.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110625035802im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ysg-card_5624.gif)
author: Alessandro Segalini

comments.content: If it's Hallmark it's probably proprietary (in house made).
I see, yes, good solution indeed——anything close to it & the large 'd,l' loop ?

Bert's right. Sometimes they make some of their fonts available in card-making kits, but I don't think they use their new fonts for those kits. My [Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20110625035802/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptIDGuide.html) shows samples of most of the available Hallmark fonts. Most are included in Parts 7, 8 and 9 of the Guide, in the later pages of those sections (most samples are courtesy of typophiles Mike F. and Paul Hunt).

- Mike Yanega

Stuart Sandler's [Secret Recipe](http://web.archive.org/web/20110625035802/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg13.html), from his Font Diner site is a pretty similar style. You could also look through the fonts done by [Rob Leuschke](http://web.archive.org/web/20110625035802/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Leuschke) who used to design fonts for Hallmark.

- Mike Yanega
